meanings.definition: The amount that a pail can hold.
meanings.sent1: She carried pailfuls of water from the well to the garden.
meanings.sent2: The farmer collected pailfuls of apples from the orchard.
meanings.sent3: The children had a pailfuls race to see who could carry the most water without spilling.
meanings.sent4: His heart was filled with pailfuls of love for his family.
meanings.sent5: The old well overflowed with pailfuls of crystal-clear water.

meanings.sent1: They needed many pailfuls of sand to build the sandcastle.
meanings.sent2: The workers loaded truck after truck with pailfuls of gravel.
meanings.sent3: The campers used pailfuls of marshmallows to make s'mores around the campfire.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room in pailfuls of joy.
meanings.sent5: The garden was filled with pailfuls of colorful flowers in full bloom.
